page.title: 02EDUCATION ST.MARTINS I.O.S.
page.content: In this Primary School on St.Martins Isles of Scilly there are only seven children and one teacher. The pupils ages range from 6 years to 11 years.The good thing about having such a small school is that we all get individual attention.The trouble with having such a small school is that we don't have a choice of friends.Because we live on an island we can go out and do work about the enviroment.You start school by coming on Friday afternoons when you are three and nine months, then you go two afternoons, then every afternoon, then you go every afternoon and two mornings, then you go all week until you are eleven, when you go to Secondary School.There are two classrooms, one is used for quiet work and the other for practical activities.We do not lack materials and equipment because we are small.
